description: Function: Unwinds DNA strands using energy from ATP hydrolysis, enabling replication, repair, and recombination; Role in LAB: Maintains genome stability and supports efficient DNA replication and repair in lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports LAB viability and persistence during fermentation and in gut environments by ensuring genetic integrity; Biological Pathways: Involved in DNA replication, repair, and recombination Pathwayss, contributing to overall cellular stability and adaptation.

Function: Synthesizes DNA using a DNA template, essential for replication and repair; Role in LAB: Maintains genome stability and supports efficient DNA replication, enabling proper growth and division of lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Ensures LAB viability and consistency during fermentation, supporting probiotic activity and food quality; Biological Pathways: Involved in DNA replication and repair Pathways, contributing to genetic fidelity and cellular stability.

Function: Transfers phosphate groups to specific substrates, facilitating key metabolic reactions; Role in LAB: Supports phosphorylation processes essential for carbohydrate metabolism and energy production in lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances LAB growth and metabolic activity during fermentation, contributing to efficient production and stability of fermented foods; Biological Pathways: Participates in metabolic and energy-generating Pathwayss, linking substrate phosphorylation to overall cellular metabolism.

Function: Catalyzes the interconversion of alcohols and aldehydes/ketones using NAD?/NADH; Role in LAB: Helps maintain redox balance and supports energy metabolism during fermentation, enabling efficient growth of lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Contributes to flavor, aroma, and alcohol metabolism in fermented foods, enhancing quality and sensory properties; Biological Pathways: Involved in glycolysis/gluconeogenesis, pyruvate metabolism, and various amino acid and lipid metabolic Pathwayss, linking energy and carbon metabolism in LAB.

Function: Synthesizes carbamoyl phosphate, which helps produce amino acids and nucleotides; Role in LAB: Provides essential precursors for amino acid and nucleotide synthesis, supporting LAB growth and protein production; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances fermentation efficiency and improves flavor, texture, and nutritional quality of foods; Biological Pathways: Involved in arginine biosynthesis, pyrimidine metabolism, and amino acid metabolism, linking nitrogen assimilation to essential biomolecule production.

Function: Catalyzes the carboxylation of acetyl-CoA to malonyl-CoA, a key step in fatty acid biosynthesis; Role in LAB: Provides building blocks for lipid synthesis, supporting cell membrane formation, growth, and metabolic activity in lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Contributes to membrane integrity and metabolic efficiency, enhancing LAB survival and functionality during fermentation and in probiotic products; Biological Pathways: Involved in fatty acid biosynthesis, pyruvate metabolism, and carbon metabolism, linking energy and lipid production in LAB.

Function: Transports polar amino acids across cell membranes using ATP energy; Role in LAB: Supplies essential amino acids for protein synthesis and metabolic processes, supporting LAB growth and activity; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances nutrient uptake during fermentation, improving LAB performance and contributing to the nutritional quality of fermented foods; Biological Pathways: Involved in ABC transporter systems and membrane transport, facilitating amino acid uptake and cellular homeostasis in LAB.

Function: Synthesizes RNA from a DNA template, enabling transcription of genetic information; Role in LAB: Supports gene expression and protein production, essential for growth, metabolism, and adaptation in lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Ensures active metabolism and functional activity of LAB during fermentation, contributing to consistent product quality and probiotic effects; Biological Pathways: Involved in transcription and RNA synthesis Pathways, linking DNA information to protein production and cellular function in LAB.

Function: Modifies DNA topology by ATP-dependent unwinding and rewinding, relieving supercoiling and tangling; Role in LAB: Maintains genome stability and facilitates replication, transcription, and recombination in lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Supports LAB viability and proper gene expression during fermentation, ensuring consistent probiotic activity and product quality; Biological Pathways: Involved in DNA replication, repair, and recombination Pathways, regulating DNA structure and cellular stability in LAB.

Function: Converts 3-phosphoglycerate to 2-phosphoglycerate in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis; Role in LAB: Supports energy production and central carbon metabolism, enabling efficient growth and metabolic activity in lactic acid bacteria; Probiotic/Food Relevance: Enhances fermentation efficiency and energy availability, contributing to LAB performance and quality of fermented foods; Biological Pathways: Involved in glycolysis, gluconeogenesis, and amino acid metabolism, linking carbohydrate processing to energy and biosynthetic Pathways in LAB.
